content.description: Use the seam in the rock to get up and then continue to the top on the steep slab
content.location: Once you reach the face, go around to the right. Its just right of the arete

content.description: Starts on the wide horizontal crack taht runs through the boulder. Once you are standing shoot for a high pocket up and to the right to top out
content.location: From the face of the Inca Boulder, walk around to the right to find this climb

content.description: A slightly slabby climb on thin hands and feet to the top
content.location: From the face, walk around to the right of the boulder

content.description: Route straight through the center of the boulder. Get yourself up and onto the rail, then continue on nice ledges through the groove and over the top
Just inside of the sloped arete, climb the face on shallow divots and pockets
content.location: Walk around to the face and then look to the right side. Its just left of the sloping corner

content.description: Wrangle up into the wide crack, take a turn and walk off
content.location: On the far side of the boulder, from the trail

content.description:
A big tall highball topping out at 28 feet.  This thing is no joke.  Chill v2ish climbing to an (almost) no hands rest.  After you take your rest, it is game on to the top. The crux is the 2nd to last move.  Your feet will be about 20 feet off of the deck, and a fall would hurt pretty bad.  It is a clean landing, but a big fall.  A good mix of techy feet, and a little bit of grrr should get you to the top.

Has bolts at the top that were put there for cleaning, they are also good for setting up TR.  Walk up the back of the boulder (also the down-climb) to set it up.
content.protection: A small stack of pads and spotters to make sure you land on them.
content.location: Left face on the Inca Boulder.  It is quite clean compared to the right side.  Route finishes at the tallest section.

content.description: A well textured face covered in divots, pockets and ledges makes this a great climb. The hardest spot is wrangling with the seam through the middle
